timing: Five times daily (Fajr, Dhuhr, Asr, Maghrib, Isha) at specific times based on sun position
steps: Ritual ablution (wudu) - washing of hands, face, arms, feet
Recitation of Quran (Al-Fatiha and other surahs)
Taslim (saying peace be upon you - ending prayer)
name: Salat
participants: All Muslims (five times daily individually or in congregation)
primarySources: The Holy Quran - Surah Al-Baqarah (2), Ta-Ha (20), Al-Ankabut (29), Al-Mu'minun (23)
Sahih Al-Bukhari - Book of Times of Prayers, Book of Characteristics of Prayer
The Prophet's Prayer Described by Shaykh al-Albani
Inner Dimensions of Islamic Worship by Imam al-Ghazali

description: Salat is a significant ritual practice in islamic tradition.
prohibitions: Cannot pray with impurity (must perform wudu)
Cannot pray toward direction other than Mecca
Impure thoughts or distractions break focus
Women must maintain modesty; some traditions exclude during menses
Must not pray in inappropriate locations
